Key Match Events: The Charlotte Hornets lost to the Cleveland Cavaliers 128-114.
Post-Match Reflections: LaMelo Ball apologized for his recent comment and promised to conduct himself better in the future.
Hornets head coach Charles Lee said Ball is 'obviously very apologetic' about the 'offensive' comment.
Miscellaneous Highlights: LaMelo Ball was fined $100,000 by the NBA for using an anti-gay slur.
Ball's comment was made during a live interview after the Hornets' 115-114 win over the Milwaukee Bucks.
Others: LaMelo Ball is in his fifth season with the Charlotte Hornets, who selected him with the third overall pick in the 2020 NBA Draft.
